oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: York, Alvin Cullum, 1887-1964; Clippings (Books, newspapers, etc.); Scrapbooks; Fund raising
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Newspaper clipping headlined "York Tag Day Tomorrow, Benefit for the York Farm Fund." It declares the fund-raiser to be under the auspices of the Nashville Rotary Club and provides a brief description of York's World War I exploits and awards.

Alvin York was one of the most decorated American soldiers in World War I. He was awarded a Medal of Honor and a French Croix de Guerre for taking a German machine gun nest and assisting in the capture of 132 German soldiers. The York property, later to become a state park, was paid for by the Nashville Rotary Club, but it was built in York's hometown of Pall Mall in Fentress County.
